p: Differential Moranâ€™s I statistic and LISA analyses were used to explore the variation of spatial autocorrelation over time. In these differential analyses, a hotspot indicated that a higher than average case incidence in the highlighted neighbourhood during the first time period led to a higher than average case incidence in the bordering neighbourhoods during the following time period. These analyses were performed for the CHIKV and ZIKV cases for each month of their epidemics: July 2014 to April 2015 for CHIKV and October 2015 to June 2016 for ZIKV cases ( Figures S8 and S9). GeoDa software was used to perform the exploratory spatial clustering analyses [ 60, 61, 62, 63].
